intro: Vieusseuxia tricuspis, commonly known as the three-lobed sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, tri-lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean, this plant thrives in saline and sandy soils. Its aromatic foliage and unique appearance make it a notable species in coastal botany. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh maritime conditions.
